intro: Mascagnia subsericea, commonly known as the silverleaf mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-yellow and are borne in clusters. The fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are used in traditional medicinal practices.
